ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: The sights,filled his optics, the sounds were all around him, echoing through the trees. The smells of animals he had yet to encounter, but seemed familiar.He

The sights,filled his optics, the sounds were all around him, echoing 
through the trees. The smells of animals he had yet to encounter, but 
seemed familiar.He assumed these were the Maximals. He caught traces 
of burnt trees, and chared earth from thier previous battles, but 
somehow the wildlife didn't seem affected.

"I smell something out of the ordinary."

He didn't know ordinary but he knew what he smelled didn't belong.

How far till we're at the Ark? maybe you should call ahead to be sure.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> "It's been a while.  But the computer should recognize me.  I 
wasn't gone 
> that long." She walked along the path on the mountain side.
> She hoped the computer remembered her signal.  She walked along 
smelling the 
> air and hearing the sounds.  It felt great to be back with 
friends. "So, 
> anything on your mind or just enjoying the scenery?"
> They had a ways to go before they would reach the ark.
> 
> 
> ----original message----
> From:   <cyberwolf4@p...>
> Date: Fri Jun 30, 2000 9:34pm
> Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
> 
> (You started flying toward it, so I thought you were bringing it to
> me. Wolves don't fly.)
> 
> well anyway, Lunarpine exits the pod, The green jungle of Tibet
> nearly hypnotized him. The green was a surprisingly nice change from
> what he was usedto. the myriad of smells told him he would eat well
> here.
> 
> Lunarpine followed Shadow Wing toward the Ark.
> 
> "So how longs it been since your last visit?"He asked hoping they'd
> remember her.He'd hate to be greeted by gunfire.
> 
> 
> 
>
